attributes.action: Force Rail Ticketing to allow for WFH and Auto Delay/Cancellation Repayments
attributes.background:
Our Rail ticketing is clearly out of date and the rail companies are failing 
1) Automatic Repayments should be mandatory for Delays and Cancellations 
2)With occasional Working From Home, tickets should be for a number of days usage not a calendar month or year
attributes.additional_details: The last few year rail travel has been appalling, Southern started a scheme to automatically refund for delays, South Western Railway have stopped this without filling in forms needing completion. They have our details linked to the ticket, this should be an automatic process. Our ticketing is out of date and the rail companies are frankly failing.

attributes.action: £85,000 turnover to remain non-taxable after becoming VAT registered.
attributes.background: For small businesses to grow allow taking of £85,000 (VAT threshold) to be non-taxable and exempt from VAT. Only make business pay 20% VAT on takings which exceed the threshold and not on the total taxable turnover. Currently becoming VAT registered as a small business is financially crippling.

attributes.action: Require dining establishments (restaurants, bars, pubs) to offer metal straws.
attributes.background: In response to the problem of an ever-increasing amount of plastic waste polluting our environment, we need to make restaurants, bars, pubs and any similar establishments offer metal straws as a substitution for plastic straws. This will benefit our planet, dining establishments and customers alike.
attributes.additional_details: Metal straws are a better alternative to paper straws as they are reusable. Similar to dishware including mugs and glasses, metal straws can be washed and reused. Therefore, the use of metal straws will produce no waste. The reusable nature of metal straws also provide financial benefits for the establishments as it is a one-time purchase. Furthermore, it addresses the 'soggy' issue of paper straws providing a practical alternative that all people can use.

attributes.action: Funding/ Installation of Wildlife Crossings (Eco Bridges)
attributes.background: We should be funding safe alternatives for animals to pass over or under our busy dangerous roads. We build these roads through their habitats and offer nothing to prevent thousands of animals deaths occurring each year. Something must be done to help protect our struggling wildlife population.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of successful Eco Bridges are in The Netherlands (over 66 crossings), Australia, Germany, California, Florida, Canada and many more. All have been successful in increasing numbers in wildlife.
The 4 ways that roads negatively impact wildlife: 1 decrease in habitat, 2 increase mortality due to wildlife-vehicle collisions, 3 prevent access to resources on the other side of the road, and 4 they subdivide wildlife populations into smaller and more vulnerable sub-populations.

attributes.action: Stop firework work displays  on armistice Sunday
attributes.background: Today  on the 11/11/2018 silence fell at 11am to mark 100 years  of the first world war and  silence was across  the globe. No fireworks on this day

attributes.action: Large donations to political parties validated by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
At present each political party validates large donations to their party. The Electoral Commission should validate and either approve or reject the donation . After validation the funds would be transferred to the party.
Make all donations and rejected donations public. Apply one set of rules.

attributes.action: Ban Blockchain Mining in the UK
attributes.background: The mining of cryptocurrency such as bitcoin is responsible for the output of enormous amounts of carbon dioxide emissions, the effects of which could cause substantial damage to the environment and contribute to global warming, rising sea levels and more unpredictable extreme weather.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/17/bitcoin-electricity-usage-huge-climate-cryptocurrency

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/29/bitcoin-may-cause-catastrophic-climate-change-2033-study-warns/

attributes.action: Improvement of animal welfare labelling on all animal or animal produce products
attributes.background: Displaying shocking pictures like that on smoking packets of the welfare standards for the worse welfare foods and a rated system on all animal produce/meat foods. Legal labelling for all foods and restaurants including foods incorporating meat or produce.
attributes.additional_details: Our labelling of meat sold in supermarkets is awful. We have the red tractor and we have RSPCA assured. I am very annoyed that we still sell caged chicken eggs, why? To save the consumer a matter of pence, at the detriment to the animal, then you have “free range” which doesn’t always mean that their welfare is higher than that of a caged chicken.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Hair dye to the public.
attributes.background: According to the BBC 33% of the public that dye there hair at home have some form of reaction, Many of this 33% have had a terrible reaction leading them into hospital and seeking expert advice. The public some into salons for hair colourist to fix there problem which can be a very long process.
attributes.additional_details: I push that the sale of hair dye should be prohibited, This will decrease the % of people having a reaction to hair dye. Hairdressers always preform a patch test to check if someone is allergic to the main chemical ingredients of hair dye. I ask that hair dye is strictly available for professionals only who hold the relevant qualification.

attributes.action: Enforce companies to label products and packaging with decomposition dates.
attributes.background: I am just an ordinary person who wants to help save our planet from drowning in plastic. If every item and its packaging were labelled with a date showing how much time they would take to decompose, then companies would be forced to re-evaluate their products and packaging.
attributes.additional_details: Labelling goods and packaging with decomposition dates would also increase awareness in society and people would make informed environmental choices when buying items. There is plastic everywhere. Take a walk around your local supermarket, or any other shop and observe the masses of plastic that is literally everywhere. Some normal plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose. A plastic bottle can take up to 450 years or more. If the government agreed to decomposition date labels on all goods and packaging, it would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Hold banks properly to account over negligent handling of bank card fraud claims
attributes.background:
Banks are currently allowed to deny card fraud claims without providing evidence for their decision to customers.

They are not protecting our money and personal data from card fraud. At a time when large companies suffer mass data breaches this is not acceptable behaviour and should be penalised.
attributes.additional_details:
Banks avoid reimbursing the value of stolen funds, or compensating victims of bank fraud, not least because the Police, Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS) are under-resourced and unable to cope with a growing epidemic of digital crime.

Government should:

- ask the FCA to conduct an investigation into this issue;
- amend the law to allow the FCA or FOS to issue fines in individual cases; and
- better resource the Ombudsman to conduct further investigations.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: UK to impose sanctions on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: The world is in shock of the brutality of Saudi Arabia's politicians!

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory 42 year prison sentences for using a knife against another.
attributes.background: The knife crime epidemic in the UK is out of control.  There is at present no suitable deterrent and with the increasing lawlessness and lack of visible policing, evildoers are increasingly prepared to threaten and use a knife against a fellow citizen.  Knife injuries for victims are life sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN04304

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/uk-knife-crime-police-gang-violence-stabbings-record-figures-a8589626.html

https://www.statista.com/statistics/864736/knife-crime-in-london/

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/crimeandjustice/bulletins/crimeinenglandandwales/yearendingmarch2018

attributes.action: All consumables, must by law have a biodegradable time scale stated them.
attributes.background: If for example "Bio 1mo" or "Bio 600yr" had to be printed or stamped on consumables by law.  Making consumers see how long their item will take to biodegrade may make ppl think twice. Biodegradable is a misinterpreted word, by stating actual time scales consumers can make an informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: We are killing our planet, slowly suffocating it. People still do not like to be told what to do, by putting the ball back in their hands, letting them make the choice by actually seeing what effect their lifestyle has in real time may make ppl think more and make better chioces.

attributes.action: Public inquiry into Barnsley Local Authority Social Services
attributes.background: A Judge seriously criticised Barnsley Local Authority Social Services  for their heavy-handed tactics whilst conducting safeguarding investigations into a vulnerable child who talked about “wanting to kill herself to be with her mum” who had committed suicide.
attributes.additional_details: The actions of Barnsley Social Services have also been criticised by others and should be subject to a public inquiry.

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: End Equal Opportunities Question about your race when applying for jobs
attributes.background: When applying for a job vacancies in the UK the employer always state that they are an equal opportunity employer and  you are required to state your ethnic minority group. Now this give the employer the opertunity discriminate against prospective employees the election  process.
attributes.additional_details: People from ethnic minority groups are being discriminate against whilst applying for job vacancy online In the pre selection process by employer. The question about stating what ethnic minority group you are from should be omitted from online application forms all together. If you are applying for a job that you are qualified for the question about your race shouldn't be of importance to the employer for selection. I applied for the same job with the same details but change my race from one to next and recieve a call the following day.

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Make GBL a higher class than cannabis, currently only a class C
attributes.background: A lot of people have died from the date rape drug GBL yet it’s only a class C and available to buy got cleaning purposes off the internet.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me get backing for this share it as much as you like. I’ve lost too many people to the drug and don’t see how it’s a lower class than cannabis.

attributes.action: Provide vegetarian friendly capsules on the NHS
attributes.background: Every time I have to have medication, I have to ask for liquid or tablets. Then when I speak to either doctors or nurses, they moan that "capsules are cheaper to make." If that is the case, change the capsules to vegetarian friendly capsules.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS should have to buy vegetarian friendly capsules where they are available and must work the drug companies to ensure that all capsules supplied to the NHS are vegetarian friendly. Most vegetarians know that capsules are not vegetarian friendly. So the more people (vegetarians and meat eaters) help to try to fight this change the better it is.

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS workers  to pay for registration renewel
attributes.background: I want action because NHS workers shouldn’t have to pay to go to work. They work long hours with stretched resources, often their is not enough staff with little opportunity for breaks. Both my parents work for the NHS, with my mother having been part of the service for more than 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Renewing registration can cost practitioners in the NMC £120 per year and practitoners in the hcpc costs £180 for two years registration. They pay the fee despite wage rises being frozen for two years from 2011, and increases capped at 1% until this year. However, despite the proposed pay increases this won’t cover the registration fee and is minimal in comparison to inflation.

attributes.action: Create a criminal offence of filming/observing a crime without helping
attributes.background: Social media, and broader internet space, is being littered with videos, mostly taken on mobile phones, showing assaults on the public and police officers. Quite often, the filmmaker is with a larger group of bystanders, who all stand by and observe the violence but fail to summon help or intervene
attributes.additional_details: Involuntary manslaughter, joint enterprise and gross negligence all deal with bystander type liability. But they require some kind of intent or legal duty. What about those who have no intent to harm anyone, and only owe a moral duty, and not statutory. It’s not acceptable for a person, without a reasonable excuse, to observe harm being done, and fail to get that person help, or if able to, attempt to stop the harm. Filming violence or doing NOTHING should never be acceptable.

attributes.action: More training for teachers in supporting and identifying childhood trauma
attributes.background: The number of children experiencing abuse is much higher than acknowledged and is a serious issue in society, leading to addiction, crime and costing the NHS a huge amount. We can target the root of the problem and give teachers, people who see children day in day out, the skills to support and help

attributes.action: Make teaching sexual abuse/assualt in more detail part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Many people (adults and children alike) who have been abused often say that they didn't realise what was happening was actually abuse for a very long time.  By educating children about what is abuse will empower them to protect themselves.  Abusers rely ignorance and secrecy.
attributes.additional_details: By talking about abuse of any kind openly and freely we take away the secrecy and make it less of a taboo subject and people may, hopefully, 1. be more aware of how to protect themselves, 2. feel more able to speak up if something does happen to them, 3. make abusers more wary of abusing.

attributes.action: Support Chez Save A Life Methanol Awareness campaign.
attributes.background: After Cheznye passed away in Thailand in 2013, our family started a campaign to make other tourists aware of the risks of Methanol Poisoning when abroad. After countless discussions with the governmental figures they decided that Methanol Poisoning awareness was not a priority for them.
attributes.additional_details: As a family we have still tried to push Methanol Awareness but alone, our message doesn't spread far enough. 17 more tourists have suffered Methanol Posioning in Zante recently and I don't suspect this will be the last cases unless we create some awareness for tourists. We need support to from our government to raise awareness and save lives.

attributes.action: Install a fence or screen in the middle of motorways to prevent rubber necking
attributes.background: Rubber necking creates massive amounts of traffic even on a road that is totally unaffected. For example, an accident on the opposite carriage can cause a queue or a crash due to people looking across the road instead of where they're going. We need to install screens or barriers to prevent this!

attributes.action: Reduce the eligibility of Police long service medal from 20 to 15 years
attributes.background:
Emergency services especially in current times face dangers day in and day out. But have to wait 5 years longer for any formal recognition.
It is proposed that the long service medal of both the police and fire service should be reduced from 20 years to 15 years exactly like the armed forces.

attributes.action: Mandate HMRC to say 'thank you' to small businesses
attributes.background: UK Entrepreneurs have started 5.7 million small businesses & employ more than 16 million people. Since 2010 alone they have created 2 million jobs. The blood, sweat and tears of these entrepreneurs goes unnoticed by HMRC, despite the huge tax contribution to the UK Govt. Just say thank you.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owners’ tax returns should say thank you for the VAT, the PAYE, the Employers NI and the Corporation Tax. This would recognise the risks they have taken to start their companies – as well as the sleepless nights, the sports days missed and the birthdays forgotten- and the contribution they make creating employment and contributing to our economy.

attributes.action: Make Homework voluntary for students in Secondary School
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Larsen Traps which cause great suffering to corvids
attributes.background: A corvid, usually a crow or magpie is held captive in a small cage, which attracts other corvids who are then killed.  The bird's most vital instincts are denied, and neglect is rife. No one knows where the traps are and The Animal Welfare Act cannot be enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
Even smarter than humans!

The crows were able to carry out both tasks and to switch between them as appropriate. That demonstrates a high level of concentration and mental flexibility which few animal species can manage — and which is an effort even for humans.
The new findings were just published in the Journal Nature Communications.
Institute for Neurobiology, University of Tübingen




Corvids are on a par with the great Apes in terms of intelligence.
Regardless of any comparisons of various brain measurements, one can conclude that the similarities between corvids and great apes in complex cognitive skills also hold for at least one less taxing skill: motor self-regulation.

 Royal Society Open Science, 2016; 3 (4): 160104 DOI: 10.1098/rsos.160104

attributes.action: Remove all right to buy legislation (including voluntary RTB) from all  Statutes
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that Social Housing has been and continues to be, damaged by Right to Buy legislation. We believe that this legislation must be removed from Statutory legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Research has shown that a high percentage of Social Housing sold under Right to Buy legislation has created a sub market for private landlords which has forced up the cost of welfare rental payments to the detriment of all tax payers.

attributes.action: Make it a legal UK requirement that councils provide public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK, public toilets are closing. These actions are unfair on all sections of our society. It is a natural requirement to use toilets. It is illegal to defecate or urinate in the street so it should be a legal requirement to provide the facilities required to avoide breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
When the body needs to meet such needs, no amount of will power will over ride this no mater what the legal penalty is so what civilised country should put its citizens in such a position.

Councils should legally provide such services in all urban areas but should also not issue licences to any businesses selling refreshments if there are not toilet facilities available to its customers within say 100 meters of the business.

attributes.action: Stop government from putting pensioners who claim pension credit on UC
attributes.background: In May this year, Amber Rudd is to bring in that a couple where the older person claims pension credit and has a partner younger will lose a lot of money, because the government will be putting them on universal credit, which means you could lose about £400 to £900 a month.

attributes.action: Begin a root and branch review to overhaul the UK's current political system
attributes.background:
We are proud that the UK is the 'mother' of parliaments but as has been shown during the Brexit process. She is no longer effective or efficient in serving its people.

We ask for an independent, root and branch review of the current political system here in the UK to make it better.

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a system of Single-Transferable Vote
attributes.background: The UK voting system favours the mentality of 'tactical voting'. People vote for a party they do not very much agree with in order to keep a party they heavily disagree with from reaching a majority in Parliament. This leads to a stale two-party political system which leaves many disenfranchised.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1945, the only two Political Parties to reach a majority in Parliament are Labour and the Conservatives. 

In the 2015 election, UKIP received a total of 3,881,099 votes and achieved 1 MP; the Liberal Democrats achieved 2,415,916 votes but won 8 MP's. Nearly 4 million people were left without a significant voice in parliament. 

Australia currently operates under Single-Transferable vote and this has allowed many smaller parties to gain traction in their Government.

attributes.action: International marriage legal right to be with family wives husbands and children
attributes.background: Even people who’ve been married for years can have to wait months or even years for a settlement visa. The Home Office never gets back to you and can keep you on hold for months or years at a time.
attributes.additional_details: There should be an automatic legal right for the partners and children of British citizens to live with them in the UK, without the ridiculous prices of visas, travel costs and time spent waiting for an outcome.

attributes.action: Funded places in nurseries for children with disabled parents!
attributes.background: For 10 months I have been trying to find affordable childcare for my daughter. I have Cystic Fibrosis and spend long periods in hospital. People cannot keep taking time off to look after her and I simply cannot afford that amount of money. There needs to be an option for disabled parents!!
attributes.additional_details: Sometimes parents with disabilities/invisible illnesses need time on hospital and for people like me with little family it can be hard to find affordable childcare. I myself cannot work, therefore have limited funds. I think there should be an option for some free hours/place at nurseries from birth instead of just the 2 year funding, my disability effects my daughter from birth. What Should I do if no one can have her? I need an option to fall back on and no other services can help me!

attributes.action: Change the law for mothers who separate and are not married
attributes.background: The law should be changed so that women who separate from a long term relationship have the right to a fair settlement of their finances and living arrangements. It’s not right that someone can be in a relationship for 15 years, have children together and have no rights.

attributes.action: Urge India and Pakistan to create an independent state in Kashmir
attributes.background: Urge India and Pakistan to create an independent state in Indian-Occupied Kashmir. Anti-India protests and clashes erupted in Indian-occupied Kashmir on Saturday after a gun battle between militants and government forces killed rebels, police and residents.
attributes.additional_details: India and Pakistan each claim the divided territory of Kashmir in its entirety. Rebels have been fighting Indian control since 1989. Many Kashmiris support the rebel cause that the territory be united either under Pakistani rule or as an independent country. India accuses Pakistan of arming and training the rebels, a charge Pakistan denies. Nearly 70,000 people have been killed in the uprising and the ensuing Indian military crackdown.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on whether to give or not give foreign aid.
attributes.background: If 80% of voters in this referendum are in favour of NOT giving foreign aid, then foreign aid should be reduced by 80%, with similar action for any result.
attributes.additional_details: A great number of people are sickened and disgusted at a) The amount given away in Foreign Aid, and b) when that aid is given to unsuitable recipients. Foreign Aid should therefore be dependant on voters allowing it to be made by voting for it.

attributes.action: Move the British embassy in Israel to Jerusalem
attributes.background: Israel like every country is allowed to make the choice of where its capital is. Israel has chosen its capital as Jerusalem. Therefore the embassy should be in Jerusalem, as most embassies are in countries’ capitals.

attributes.action: Publish Northern Ireland (no border) planning papers in a no-deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has published numerious technical notices for a no-deal Brexit outcome. Information provided covers a wide range of topics, from pet travel requirements to pharmaceuticals. Since EU can't stop the UK from a no-deal Brexit, what are the governments unilateral contingency plans for N.I.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/how-to-prepare-if-the-uk-leaves-the-eu-with-no-deal#overview

attributes.action: Change smoking warnings to include the benefits of stopping smoking
attributes.background: Smoking warnings are scare stories that may impact people but they are all one sided and only convey the negative aspects of smoking. Why not include the positive aspects of stopping smoking. Short texts documenting the benefits along with the negative could work better than the usual scare stories.
attributes.additional_details:
On the NHS website the first lines on the what happens when you stop smoking page are - Stopping smoking can make a drastic improvement to your lifestyle and health in ways you might not expect. 
And 
Once you stop smoking, some of the benefits are immediate and some are longer-term.
They then include personal stories of people who quit smoking. The question is which approach works better? The warnings or the benefits? Or even a mix of both? It seems that the one sided approach is naive at best.

attributes.action: Make landlords of privately owned student property liable for council tax
attributes.background: In the last 10 years, as the uni near my home has grown, landlords have bought and extended many properties in the area and let them to students, who all use the services provided by the council.   No one is paying for their  use of local council services eg rubbish collection.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the properties, 3 bed family homes with average sized families, have been extended so there are 8-10 students in some. They require extra refuse bins, extra demand on health services and extra policing. Landlords are earning a minimum of £120 per room per week so can afford and should be paying for the extra services the student population uses. The extra revenue would help to pay for local health and social care costs.

attributes.action: Parliament to allow the electorate to have a yes or no referendum on referendums
attributes.background: We the public are being constantly told we must have another referendum for different issues. Do we as a country want to have them in our constitution, do we have a vote on the same issue every 2 or 5 years like some want on the EU issue.
attributes.additional_details:
Some requests for referendums on the petition website: 
Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal 
Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership 
Hold a referendum for the legalisation of cannabis 
In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment 
All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future. 
Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections

attributes.action: Make it an offence to share film footage of assault with intent to humiliate.
attributes.background: Too many young people are sharing footage of fights and assaults with the intent to humiliate the innocent victims.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the UK government to make it illegal to share film footage on social media or via phone to phone where the intent is to humiliate the victim. An example being the young innocent girl who was seriously assaulted and then the footage was shared with the intent to cause her further distress.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on our EU membership, but this time including the Euro
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU referendum, there were 2 choices: Leave or Remain. We had our say. But there is a third-way: let's call it Re-Join. No more opt-outs. No more pound, even. Proper EU membership, like Germany and France. Are we so sure we want to leave, versus just joining up properly like the rest?
attributes.additional_details: The past two years have seen plenty of surprises with respect to the EU, some unpleasant. But like the turkeys who don't vote for Christmas, nobody in Westminster is offering us the one EU choice that might actually be worth considering: full membership, including the Euro. It could be our country's best bet, though. No more pound, yes. But no need for one, if our banks are built not to need bailing out in the first place. As for jobs, let's just say the sucking sound would be in our direction.

attributes.action: Fund more research into Endometriosis
attributes.background: Endometriosis is the name given to the condition where cells like the ones in the lining of the womb (uterus) are found elsewhere in the body. The actual cause of endometriosis is unknown. Around 1.5 million women in the UK are currently living with the condition.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis.
 
Endometriosis is the second most common gynaecological condition in the UK.
 
Endometriosis affects 1.5 million women, a similar number of women affected by diabetes.
 
On average it takes 7.5 years from onset of symptoms to get a diagnosis.
 
Endometriosis costs the UK economy £8.2bn a year in treatment, loss of work and healthcare costs.
 
https://www.endometriosis-uk.org/information

attributes.action: Amend Royal Charter to stop BBC paying more than twice Prime Minister’s salary
attributes.background: The BBC is a public service and should not pay excessive salaries or other payments to individuals. Paying anyone over £1.5m a year to watch and comment on sport or present a 3 hour radio show is too much. Alternative talent could be found at lower salary levels.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly funded bodies have shown disregard for financial discipline and the BBC may be the worst. If commercial entities want to pay their staff excessive salaries and perks let their shareholders approve it or otherwise. The taxpayers are the BBC shareholders and I say enough is enough. who work primarily for the BBC should also pay tax and NI like everyone else at source. The talent will evolve to fill any gaps.
